00038  * \file elemdeath.c

00071 /**
00072  * \addtogroup ElemDeath
00073  * \brief Dead element analysis routines and helper functions
00074  *
00075  * \description
00076  *
00077  *   In many simulations, changing mesh topology is approximated by 
00078  *   allowing elements to "die". The mesh topology stays the same, but any
00079  *   elements that are labeld "dead" no longer participate in the simulation.
00080  *   Dead elements can be used to model rips, tears and other changes in the
00081  *   mesh.
00082  *
00083  *   The input of most of the routines in this module is a subset representing
00084  *   a dead element region, and is assumed to have the association type of
00085  *   FC_AT_ELEMENT. It is also assumed that the coordinates of vertices within
00086  *   an dead element region cannot be trusted (the vertices on the boundary of
00087  *   the dead element region may be o.k. if they are still on live elements).
00088  *   
00089  *   A dead element region does not have to be a single topological segment,
00090  *   but most of the results are more easily interpreted if this is true.
00091  */
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00095  * \defgroup PrivateElemDeath (Private)
00096  */
00097 
00098 
00099 /** \name Decay of Subsets */
00100 //----------------------------------------------------------
00101 //@{
00102 
00103 
00104 /**
00105  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00106  * \brief Get exposed skin.
00107  *
00108  * \description 
00109  *
00110  *   Given a subset of elements, this routine returns a subset of the entities
00111  *   that would become "exposed" (i.e. become part of the mesh skin) if the
00112  *   given elements were removed from the parent mesh. The exposed skin is the
00113  *   boundary between the dead region and the rest of the mesh. It is useful as
00114  *   a subset of the dead region because all members are still "real" unlike
00115  *   entities that are totally within a dead region which may no longer have
00116  *   physical meaning.
00117  *
00118  *   Since calculating the skin of the parent mesh can be very computationally
00119  *   expension, there is an optional argument to pass in an already computed
00120  *   mesh skin.
00121  *
00122  *   If there are no exposed entities, this routine returns successfully but
00123  *   with FC_NULL_SUBSET (instead of a subset with no members).
00124  *
00125  *   This function will fail if there are no members in the input subset.
00126  *
00127  * \modifications
00128  *   - 6/27/2005 WSD. Created.
00129  */
00130 FC_ReturnCode fc_getExposedSkin(
00131   FC_Subset subset,          /**< input - A subset of "dead" elements */
00132   FC_Subset* opt_meshSkin,   /**< input - (optional) pointer to mesh skin 
00133                     (or NULL) */
00134   FC_Subset* exposed         /**< output - The exposed skin */
00135 ) {
00136   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00137   FC_AssociationType in_assoc;
00138   int numMember, maxNumMember;
00139   FC_Mesh mesh, temp_mesh;
00140   FC_Subset mesh_skin, subset_skin, union_subset;
00141   
00142   // default returns
00143   if (exposed)
00144     *exposed = FC_NULL_SUBSET;
00145 
00146   // Test input
00147   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !exposed ||
00148       (opt_meshSkin != NULL && !fc_isSubsetValid(*opt_meshSkin))) {
00149     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00150     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00151   }
00152   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, &maxNumMember, &in_assoc);
00153   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00154     return rc;
00155   if (in_assoc != FC_AT_ELEMENT && in_assoc != FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) {
00156     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset must have element or whole association");
00157     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00158   }
00159 
00160   // A little setup and more testing
00161   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
00162   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00163     return rc;
00164   if (opt_meshSkin) {
00165     rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(*opt_meshSkin, &temp_mesh);
00166     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00167       return rc;
00168     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, temp_mesh)) {
00169       fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset and mesh sking must be on the same mesh");
00170       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00171     }
00172   }
00173 
00174   // Error case - No dead elements // FIX? is this really an error?
00175   if (numMember == 0) {
00176     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot handle empty subset");
00177     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00178   }
00179     
00180   // Special case - all elements are dead
00181   if (in_assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH ||  numMember == maxNumMember) {
00182     // return NULL handle
00183     return FC_SUCCESS;
00184   }
00185 
00186   // Setup - get the skin's of the mesh and the subset
00187   if (opt_meshSkin)
00188     mesh_skin = *opt_meshSkin;
00189   else {
00190     rc = fc_getMeshSkin(mesh, &mesh_skin);
00191     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00192       return rc;
00193   }
00194   rc = fc_getSubsetSkin(subset, &subset_skin);
00195   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00196     return rc;
00197 
00198   // Exposed enties are subset_skin - any skin shared with orig mesh
00199   // Union of mesh & subset skins will give us overlap
00200   rc = fc_createSubsetIntersection(mesh_skin, "AND", subset_skin, "temp",
00201                        &union_subset);
00202   if (!opt_meshSkin)
00203     fc_deleteSubset(mesh_skin);
00204   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00205     fc_deleteSubset(subset_skin);
00206     return rc;
00207   }
00208   // Xor of overlap and subset skin should give skin NOT overlapping
00209   rc = fc_createSubsetIntersection(subset_skin, "XOR", union_subset,
00210                        "temp", exposed);
00211   fc_deleteSubset(subset_skin);
00212   fc_deleteSubset(union_subset);
00213 
00214   // done
00215   return rc;
00216 }
00217 
00218 /**
00219  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00220  * \brief Get decayed skin
00221  *
00222  * \description 
00223  *
00224  *   Given a dead element region and the skin of a mesh or subset, 
00225  *   returns a subset which is the intersection of the dead
00226  *   element region and the skin, referred to as the "decayedSkin".
00227  *   The return subset is named "DecayedSkin". 
00228  *
00229  *   The dead region must have association FC_AT_ELEMENT, the
00230  *   skin must have association FC_AT_FACE, and the return subset
00231  *   has the assocation FC_AT_FACE. Both input subsets must be on the
00232  *   same mesh. If you want the elements of the decayed face, call
00233  *   \ref fc_createSubsetIntersection directly on the dead region and
00234  *   subset giving rise to the input skin.
00235  *
00236  *   This method does not check that the initial subsets actually
00237  *   describe a dead region and a skin, so this can in fact be used to
00238  *   calculate the intersection of any element subset and some other skin.
00239  *   It is being placed in elemdeath however, because 
00240  *   this function was developed for a specific dead element need and
00241  *   and using the deadelement terminology in this function name
00242  *   is beneficial.
00243  *
00244  *   Notes:
00245  *    - if the deadregion is NULL or the input skin is empty,
00246  *      returns with error (this is to be consistent with
00247  *      \ref fc_getExposedSkin)
00248  *    - if the input skin is NULL, it creates the mesh skin
00249  *    - if the dead region is empty, returns empty subset.
00250  *    - if there are no intersections, returns a subset with no members.
00251  *
00252  *
00253  * \modifications
00254  *   - 11/30/2005 ACG Created via moving here from surface demo code.
00255  *   - 12/05/2005 ACG Added the unittest (see todo above).
00256  *   - 03/01/2006 ACG added explicit type checking for hte input subsets
00257  *   - 03/02/2006 ACG changing name for DecayedMeshSkin to DecayedSkin since
00258  *                    the skin doesnt have to be a meshskin
00259  *   - 07/16/2006 ACG This was fc_getDecayedSkinSegments, but removing 
00260  *                    the segmenting
00261  */
00262 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDecayedSkin(
00263   FC_Subset deadregion, /**< input - dead region elements*/
00264   FC_Subset* opt_meshSkin, /**< input - optional ptr to mesh skin or NULL */
00265   FC_Subset* decayedSkin /**< output - skin items ids comprising the dead skin (not segmented) */
00266   ){
00267   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00268   FC_Mesh mesh1, mesh2;
00269   FC_Subset deadregionskin,meshskin,createmeshskin,deadfaces;
00270   FC_AssociationType assocdead, assocskin;
00271   int n_dead, n_skin;
00272   int junk;
00273 
00274 
00275   // default returns
00276   if (decayedSkin)
00277     *decayedSkin = FC_NULL_SUBSET;
00278 
00279   // Test input. 
00280   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(deadregion) || !decayedSkin ||
00281       (opt_meshSkin != NULL && !fc_isSubsetValid(*opt_meshSkin))){
00282     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00283     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00284   }
00285 
00286   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(deadregion,&n_dead,&junk,&assocdead);
00287   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00288     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get info of dead region");    
00289     return rc;
00290   }
00291 
00292   if (assocdead != FC_AT_ELEMENT){
00293     fc_printfErrorMessage("deadregion must have element assoc");
00294     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00295   }
00296   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(deadregion,&mesh1);
00297   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00298     return rc;
00299   if (opt_meshSkin) {
00300     rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(*opt_meshSkin, &mesh2);
00301     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00302       return rc;
00303     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh1, mesh2)) {
00304       fc_printfErrorMessage("deadregion and skin must be on the same mesh");
00305       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00306     }
00307   }
00308 
00309   createmeshskin = FC_NULL_SUBSET;
00310   if (opt_meshSkin){
00311     meshskin = *opt_meshSkin;
00312   } else {
00313     rc = fc_getMeshSkin(mesh1, &createmeshskin);
00314     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00315       return rc;
00316     meshskin = createmeshskin;
00317   }
00318   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(meshskin,&n_skin,&junk,&assocskin);
00319   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00320     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get info of skin");    
00321     fc_deleteSubset(createmeshskin);
00322     return rc;
00323   }
00324   if (assocskin != FC_AT_FACE){
00325     fc_printfErrorMessage("skin must have face assoc");
00326     fc_deleteSubset(createmeshskin);
00327     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00328   }
00329   //have to check if the skin is empty before checking if the dead set is
00330   if (n_skin == 0){
00331     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant work on an empty skin");
00332     fc_deleteSubset(createmeshskin);
00333     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00334   }
00335   if (n_dead == 0){
00336     return FC_SUCCESS;
00337   }
00338 
00339   fc_printfLogMessage("get decayed skin ");
00340 
00341   //get the skin of the dead region
00342   rc = fc_getSubsetSkin(deadregion,&deadregionskin);
00343   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00344     fc_deleteSubset(createmeshskin);
00345     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get dead region skin");
00346     return rc;
00347   } 
00348   
00349   //intersect to get the dead faces
00350   rc = fc_createSubsetIntersection(deadregionskin,"AND",meshskin,
00351                        "DeadSkin",&deadfaces);
00352   fc_deleteSubset(deadregionskin);
00353   fc_deleteSubset(createmeshskin);
00354   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00355     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get dead mesh faces");
00356     return rc;
00357   } 
00358 
00359   *decayedSkin = deadfaces;
00360 
00361   return FC_SUCCESS;
00362 };
00363 
00364 
00365 /**
00366  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00367  * \brief Get identifier telling if deadSubset intersects, or entirely 
00368  *        erodes a subset
00369  *
00370  * \description
00371  * 
00372  *   Given a dead subset, returns an identifier
00373  *   telling if the deadSubset intersects, or entirely erodes the 
00374  *   comparisonSubset.
00375  *
00376  *   Identifier values:
00377  *     -  0 if the deadSubset doesnt intersect the compSubset at all.
00378  *     -  1 if the deadSubset intersects the compSubset.
00379  *     -  2 if the deadSubset erodes the whole compSubset.
00380  *     -  -1 in case of error
00381  *
00382  *   The deadSubset and the compSubset both have to have the same assocation.
00383  *   It must either be FC_AT_FACE or FC_AT_ELEMENT. They must also be on the
00384  *   same mesh. This function is currently a wrapper around
00385  *   \ref fc_doSubsetsIntersect and \ref fc_isSubsetSuperset and is subject to the
00386  *   constraints of those methods.
00387  *
00388  *   Fails if the compsubset is empty or null of if the deadsubset is null.
00389  *   The dead set can be empty and returns 0. (The inner calls would support
00390  *   permuations of empty and null, but the logic of the call does not).
00391  *
00392  *   In general, it is expect that this will be used to compare a dead
00393  *   region and the side of a mesh, but there is nothing that checks that
00394  *   so this can in fact be used more generally, and also misused at your
00395  *   peril. It is being placed in elemdeath however, because this function 
00396  *   was developed for a specific dead element need and using the deadelement
00397  *   terminology in this function name is beneficial. If you want to do this
00398  *   comparison for all the sides of a shape, use 
00399  *   \ref fc_getShapeSidesDecayType. 
00400  *
00401  * \todo
00402  *   - make more efficient by not having to call both the intersection and the
00403  *     superset code.
00404  *
00405  * \modifications
00406  *   - 02/14/2006 ACG fc_getSidesDecay created, which replaced
00407  *                    fc_getDecayedMeshSkinSideIntersections.
00408  *   - 07/17/2006 ACG new version born of fc_getSidesDecay.
00409  */
00410 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetDecayType(
00411    FC_Subset deadSubset, /**< input - deadSubset */
00412    FC_Subset compSubset, /**< input - comparison subset */
00413    int* sidedecayflag /**<output - decay flag  */
00414    ){
00415 
00416   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00417   FC_AssociationType assocdead, assoccomp;
00418   int ret = -1;
00419   int i;
00420 
00421   //default returns
00422   if (sidedecayflag)
00423     *sidedecayflag = -1;
00424 
00425   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(deadSubset) || !fc_isSubsetValid(compSubset) ||
00426       !sidedecayflag){
00427     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00428     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00429   }
00430 
00431   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(compSubset,FC_NULL_SUBSET)){
00432     fc_printfErrorMessage("comp subset cannot be NULL");
00433     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00434   } 
00435 
00436   rc = fc_getSubsetNumMember(compSubset,&i);
00437   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00438     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get num members of comp subset");
00439     return rc;
00440   } 
00441   if (!i){
00442     fc_printfErrorMessage("comp subset cannot be empty");
00443     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00444   }
00445 
00446   //check assoc, mesh is checked in internal calls. 
00447   rc = fc_getSubsetAssociationType(deadSubset,&assocdead);
00448   if (assocdead != FC_AT_ELEMENT && assocdead!= FC_AT_FACE){
00449     fc_printfErrorMessage("deadSubset must have face or element assoc");
00450     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00451   }
00452   rc = fc_getSubsetAssociationType(compSubset,&assoccomp);
00453   if (assoccomp != assocdead){
00454     fc_printfErrorMessage("compSubset must have smae assoc as deadSubset");
00455     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00456   }
00457 
00458   rc = fc_doSubsetsIntersect(deadSubset,compSubset,&ret);
00459   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00460     return rc;
00461   }
00462   if (ret == 1){
00463     int ind2;
00464     
00465     rc = fc_isSubsetSuperset(deadSubset,compSubset,&ind2);
00466     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00467       return rc;
00468     }
00469     ret = (ind2 == 1 ? 2:1);
00470   }
00471 
00472   *sidedecayflag  = ret;
00473   return FC_SUCCESS;
00474 };
00475 
00476 
00477 //@}
00478 
00479 
00480 /** \name Decay of Shapes */
00481 //-------------------------------
00482 //@{
00483 
00484 /**
00485  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00486  * \brief Get the decayed Skin
00487  *
00488  * \description 
00489  *
00490  *   Analogous method to \ref fc_getDecayedSkin but where
00491  *   the meshskin is that defined by a shape. If you want
00492  *   the decay information on a side-by-side basis, use
00493  *   \ref fc_getDecayedShapeSides.
00494  *   
00495  * \modifications
00496  *   - 07/16/2006 ACG created
00497  *                    
00498  */
00499 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDecayedShapeSkin(
00500   FC_Subset deadregion, /**< input - dead region elements*/
00501   FC_Shape  *shape, /**< input - ptr to shape */
00502   FC_Subset* decayedSkin /**< output - decayedSkin */
00503   ){
00504   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00505   FC_Subset *sidesdecay;
00506   int i,j;
00507 
00508   // default returns
00509   if (decayedSkin)
00510     *decayedSkin = FC_NULL_SUBSET;
00511 
00512   // Test input. 
00513   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(deadregion) || !shape || !shape->numSides ||
00514       !decayedSkin){
00515     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00516     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00517   }
00518 
00519   rc = fc_getDecayedShapeSides(deadregion,shape,&sidesdecay);
00520   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00521     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get decayed shape skin");
00522     return rc;
00523   }
00524 
00525 
00526   for (i = 1; i < shape->numSides; i++){
00527     int num, *arr;
00528     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sidesdecay[i],FC_NULL_SUBSET)){
00529       rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(sidesdecay[i],&num,&arr);
00530       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00531      fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get subset members as array");
00532      fc_deleteSubset(sidesdecay[0]);
00533      for (j = i; j < shape->numSides; j++){
00534        fc_deleteSubset(sidesdecay[j]);
00535      }
00536      free(sidesdecay);
00537      return rc;
00538       }
00539       rc = fc_addArrayMembersToSubset(sidesdecay[0],num,arr);
00540       free(arr);
00541       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00542      fc_printfErrorMessage("cant add aray members to subset");
00543      fc_deleteSubset(sidesdecay[0]);
00544      for (j = i; j < shape->numSides; j++){
00545        fc_deleteSubset(sidesdecay[j]);
00546      }
00547      free(sidesdecay);
00548      return rc;
00549       }
00550     }
00551   }
00552 
00553   *decayedSkin = sidesdecay[0];
00554   free(sidesdecay);
00555   return FC_SUCCESS;
00556 }
00557 
00558 
00559 /**
00560  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00561  * \brief Get the decayed item of each of a shapes sides
00562  *
00563  * \description 
00564  *
00565  *   Given a dead element region and a shape,
00566  *   returns an array of subsets, which is the intersection 
00567  *   of the dead and the faces of each side. This is basically
00568  *   \ref fc_getDecayedSkin called for each side in turn, so
00569  *   see the text there. 
00570  *
00571  *   If you want to get thsi information for a single side,
00572  *   call \ref fc_getDecayedSkin and send it the single
00573  *   side face subset.
00574  *
00575  *   If the inner calls fail for any of the sides, the whole thing fails.
00576  *   
00577  *
00578  * \modifications
00579  *   - 03/02/2006 ACG fc_getDecayedSidesSegments created
00580  *   - 07/16/2006 ACG This is born from fc_getDecayedSkinSegments,
00581  *                    but without the segmenting.
00582  */
00583 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDecayedShapeSides(
00584   FC_Subset deadregion, /**< input - dead region elements*/
00585   FC_Shape  *shape, /**< input - shape */
00586   FC_Subset** decayedSides /**< output - decayedSkin subsets,
00587                     one for each face*/
00588   ){
00589   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00590   FC_Subset *sidesdecay;
00591   int i,j;
00592 
00593   // default returns
00594   if (decayedSides!= NULL)
00595     *decayedSides = NULL;
00596 
00597   // Test input. 
00598   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(deadregion) || !shape || !shape->numSides ||
00599       !decayedSides){
00600     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00601     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00602   }
00603 
00604   sidesdecay = (FC_Subset*)malloc((shape->numSides) * sizeof(FC_Subset));
00605   if (!sidesdecay){
00606     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00607     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00608   }
00609 
00610   for (i = 0; i < shape->numSides; i++){
00611     rc = fc_getDecayedSkin(deadregion,&(shape->faces[i]),&sidesdecay[i]);
00612     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00613       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get decayedSkin of face %d",i);
00614       for (j = 0; j < i; j++){
00615      fc_deleteSubset(sidesdecay[j]);
00616       }
00617       free(sidesdecay);
00618       return rc;
00619     }
00620   }
00621 
00622   *decayedSides = sidesdecay;
00623   return FC_SUCCESS;
00624 }
00625 
00626 /**
00627  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00628  * \brief Get identifier telling if deadSubset intersects or entirely 
00629  *        erodes the sides of a shape.
00630  *
00631  * \description
00632  * 
00633  *   Given a dead subset, returns an array of identifiers,
00634  *   one for each side of a shape, telling if the deadSubset
00635  *   intersects or entirely erodes the sides of a shape.
00636  *
00637  *   Identifier values:
00638  *     -  0 if the deadSubset doesnt intersect the sides at all.
00639  *     -  1 if the deadSubset intersects the side
00640  *     -  2 if the deadSubset erodes the whole side.
00641  *     -  -1 in case of error
00642  *
00643  *   The dead subset can have assoc FC_AT_FACE or FC_AT_ELEM.
00644  *   The dead subset and shape have to be on the same mesh.
00645  *   This function is essentially a wrapper around 
00646  *   \ref fc_getSubsetDecayType. If you want this functionally
00647  *   for only 1 side of the Shape, then call \ref fc_getSubsetDecayType.
00648  *
00649  *   Right now, if any side fails, the whole thing fails, since
00650  *   you wouldnt have an empty or NULL side in a shape and therefore
00651  *   this is probably indicative of a more serious error in your shape.
00652  *
00653  *   While this is expected to be used for a dead region and a shape,
00654  *   there is nothing that checks that it is a dead region and
00655  *   so it can be used more generally. It is being placed in
00656  *   elemdeath however, because this function 
00657  *   was developed for a specific dead element need and using 
00658  *   the deadelement
00659  *   terminology in this function name is beneficial. 
00660  *
00661  * \todo
00662  *   - do we want this to succeed if any one side is bad?
00663  *
00664  * \modifications
00665  *   - 02/14/2006 ACG fc_getSidesDecay created, which replaced
00666  *                    fc_getDecayedMeshSkinSideIntersections.
00667  *   - 07/17/2006 ACG new version born of fc_getSidesDecay.
00668  */
00669 FC_ReturnCode fc_getShapeSidesDecayType(
00670    FC_Subset deadSubset, /**< input - deadSubset */
00671    FC_Shape *shape, /**< input - ptr to shape */
00672    int** sidedecayflag /**<output - decay flag array */
00673    ){
00674 
00675   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00676   FC_AssociationType assocdead;
00677   int *flags;
00678   int usefaces = 0;
00679   int i;
00680 
00681   //default returns
00682   if (sidedecayflag)
00683     *sidedecayflag = NULL;
00684 
00685   //other things chekced inside
00686   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(deadSubset) || !shape ||
00687       !sidedecayflag){
00688     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00689     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00690   }
00691 
00692   flags = (int*)malloc(shape->numSides*sizeof(int));
00693   if (!flags){
00694     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00695     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;  
00696   }
00697 
00698   //check assoc, mesh is checked in internal calls. 
00699   rc = fc_getSubsetAssociationType(deadSubset,&assocdead);
00700   if (assocdead != FC_AT_ELEMENT && assocdead!= FC_AT_FACE){
00701     fc_printfErrorMessage("deadSubset must have face or element assoc");
00702     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00703   }
00704   if (assocdead == FC_AT_FACE){
00705     usefaces = 1;
00706   } //otherwise use elems
00707 
00708   for (i = 0; i < shape->numSides; i++){
00709     FC_Subset tempSubset;
00710     if (usefaces){
00711       tempSubset = shape->faces[i];
00712     }else{
00713       tempSubset = shape->elems[i];
00714     }
00715     rc = fc_getSubsetDecayType(deadSubset,tempSubset,&flags[i]);
00716     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00717       fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get decay type for side %d",i);
00718       free(flags);
00719       return rc;
00720     }
00721   }
00722 
00723   *sidedecayflag = flags;
00724 
00725   return FC_SUCCESS;
00726 };
00727 
00728     
00729 
00730 //@}
00731 
00732 
00733 /** \name Dead region segmenting mesh */
00734 //-------------------------------
00735 //@{
00736 
00737 
00738 /**
00739  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00740  * \brief returns the segments (and their number)
00741  *  that result from segmenting the mesh by the input subset. 
00742  *
00743  * \description
00744  *
00745  *  Returns the segments (and their number) that result from segmenting
00746  *  the mesh by the input subset. If you dont want the segment array,
00747  *  then newSubsets and varname are optional parameters. If you do
00748  *  want the segments, they will be named as the varname
00749  *  parameter pospended with "_Seg#" where # will be the index
00750  *  into the array of returned subsets.
00751  *
00752  *  Returns -1 in case of error. If you pass in an empty
00753  *  subset -- this is not an error, unlike fc_exposedSkin.
00754  *
00755  *  One can pass in subsets that have nothing
00756  *  to do with dead cells as well, of course, but we anticipate
00757  *  that this will be most often used with a dead region. If
00758  *  the number of returned segments > the original number of
00759  *  segments then the subset has
00760  *  broken the mesh. If the number of returned segments = 0 then
00761  *  the subset has consumed the mesh, and therefore may also
00762  *  be considered to have broken the mesh.
00763  *
00764  *  This is the mesh equivalent of \ref fc_subsetSegmentsSubset
00765  *
00766  * \todo
00767  *   - test this for things other than elem
00768  *
00769  * \modifications
00770  *   - 8/2/2005 ACG. Created.
00771  *   - 8/5/05 ACG. reincarnation of fc_subsetBreaksMesh
00772  *   - 8/11/05 ACG made empty subset an ok case because the user
00773  *     prob wants to compare the number of segments to the orignal
00774  *     number to see if there are more. an empty subset is a valid
00775  *     case, esp if one is doing this over time.
00776  *   - 9/22/05 ACG added shared segmentation dim
00777  */
00778 FC_ReturnCode fc_subsetSegmentsMesh(
00779    FC_Subset subset, /**< input - subset testing on */
00780    int shared_segdim, /**< input - shared dim for segmentation */
00781    char* varname, /**< input - prefix for returned segments (optional) */
00782    int *numSubset, /**< output - number of resulting segments */
00783    FC_Subset **newSubsets /**< output - array of resulting segments 
00784                     (optional) */
00785 ){
00786   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00787   FC_Subset tempSubset,*tempsubarray;
00788   //  FC_AssociationType in_assoc;
00789   //  int numMember, maxNumMember;
00790   int i;
00791   char* tempname;
00792 
00793   // default returns
00794   if (numSubset)
00795     *numSubset = -1;
00796   if (newSubsets)
00797     *newSubsets = NULL;
00798 
00799 
00800   // Test input. (shared_segdim checked in fc_segment)
00801   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !numSubset || 
00802       (!newSubsets && varname) || (newSubsets && !varname))
00803        //couldnt get xor (^) to work
00804     {
00805     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00806     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00807   }
00808 
00809   // no - dont limit this to elems
00810   //NOTE: next two test sections copied from getExposedSkin above 
00811   //  rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, &maxNumMember, &in_assoc);
00812   //  if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00813   //    return rc;
00814   //
00815   //  if (in_assoc != FC_AT_ELEMENT && in_assoc != FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) {
00816   //    fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset must have element or whole association");
00817   //    return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00818   //  }
00819 
00820   fc_printfLogMessage("subsetSegmentsMesh");
00821 
00822   
00823   tempname = varname ? varname : "temp_subset";
00824 
00825   //this works for empty subset
00826   rc = fc_createSubsetComplement(subset,tempname, &tempSubset);
00827   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00828     return rc;
00829   }
00830 
00831   if (newSubsets){ //even though this is more code, onyl 1 if check 
00832     //to determine the arg and do the delete, vs doing a temp
00833     //pts variable like i did for the name above and then
00834     //having to check again for the delete
00835     rc = fc_segment(tempSubset,shared_segdim, numSubset,newSubsets);
00836     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00837       fc_deleteSubset(tempSubset);
00838       return rc;
00839     }
00840   } else {
00841     rc = fc_segment(tempSubset,shared_segdim, numSubset,&tempsubarray);
00842     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00843       fc_deleteSubset(tempSubset);
00844       return rc;
00845     }
00846     for (i = 0; i < *numSubset; i++){
00847       fc_deleteSubset(tempsubarray[i]);
00848     }
00849     free(tempsubarray);
00850   }
00851 
00852   //clean up
00853   fc_deleteSubset(tempSubset);
00854 
00855   return FC_SUCCESS;
00856 }
00857 
00858 
00859 /**
00860  * \ingroup ElemDeath
00861  * \brief returns the segments (and their number)
00862  *  that result from segmenting a subset by another subset. 
00863  *
00864  * \description
00865  *
00866  *  Returns the segments (and their number) that result from segmenting
00867  *  a subset by another subset. If you dont want the segment array,
00868  *  then newSubsets and varname are optional parameters. If you do
00869  *  want the segments, they will be named as the varname
00870  *  parameter postpended with "_Seg#" where # will be the index
00871  *  into the array of returned subsets. Note: this is not
00872  *  the additional number of segments that result, but the total - that
00873  *  is,
00874  *
00875  *  Returns -1 in case of error. If the outer subset is empty or
00876  *  MULL this returns with an error. If the inner subset is empty
00877  *  or NULL this is not an error, unlike fc_exposedSkin. Both
00878  *  subsets must have the same association and be on the same mesh.
00879  *  See \ref fc_segment for restrictions on the segmentation dimension.
00880  *
00881  *  One can pass in subsets that have nothing
00882  *  to do with dead cells as well, of course, but we anticipate
00883  *  that this will be most often used with a dead region. If
00884  *  the number of returned segments > the original number of
00885  *  segments then the inner subset has broken the outer.
00886  *  If the number of returned segments = 0 then
00887  *  the inner subset has consumed the outer, and therefore may also
00888  *  be considered to have broken the outer.
00889  *
00890  *  This is the subset equivalent of \ref fc_subsetSegmentsMesh
00891  *
00892  * \todo
00893  *   - test this for things other than elem
00894  *
00895  * \modifications
00896  *   - 2/23/06 ACG created
00897  */
00898 FC_ReturnCode fc_subsetSegmentsSubset(
00899    FC_Subset subset_inner, /**< input - subset that cuases the segmentation */
00900    FC_Subset subset_outer, /**< input - subset being segmented*/
00901    int shared_segdim, /**< input - shared dim for segmentation */
00902    char* varname, /**< input - prefix for returned segments (optional) */
00903    int *numSubset, /**< output - number of resulting segments */
00904    FC_Subset **newSubsets /**< output - array of resulting segments 
00905                     (optional) */
00906 ){
00907   FC_ReturnCode rc1, rc2;
00908   FC_Subset tempSubset,*tempsubarray;
00909   FC_Mesh mesh_inner, mesh_outer;
00910   FC_AssociationType assoc_inner, assoc_outer;
00911   int numMember_inner, numMember_outer;
00912   int maxNumMember_inner, maxNumMember_outer;
00913   int i;
00914   char* tempname;
00915 
00916   // default returns
00917   if (numSubset)
00918     *numSubset = -1;
00919   if (newSubsets)
00920     *newSubsets = NULL;
00921 
00922 
00923   // Test input. (shared_segdim checked in fc_segment)
00924   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset_inner) ||!fc_isSubsetValid(subset_outer) ||
00925       !numSubset || (!newSubsets && varname) ||(newSubsets && !varname)){
00926     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00927     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00928   }
00929 
00930   rc1 = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset_inner,&mesh_inner);
00931   rc2 = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset_outer,&mesh_outer);
00932   if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS)
00933     return rc1;
00934   else if (rc2 != FC_SUCCESS)
00935     return rc2;
00936   if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh_outer, mesh_inner)){
00937     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subsets must be on same mesh");
00938     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00939   }
00940 
00941   rc1 = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset_inner, &numMember_inner, &maxNumMember_inner, &assoc_inner);
00942   rc2 = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset_outer, &numMember_outer, &maxNumMember_outer, &assoc_outer);
00943   if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS)
00944     return rc1;
00945   else if (rc2 != FC_SUCCESS)
00946     return rc2;
00947 
00948   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(subset_outer, FC_NULL_SUBSET) || numMember_outer == 0){
00949     fc_printfErrorMessage("Outer subset cannot be empty or NULL ");
00950     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00951   }
00952 
00953   //  if (assoc_inner != FC_AT_ELEMENT || assoc_outer != FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
00954   //    fc_printfErrorMessage("Subsets must have element assoc ");
00955   //    return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00956   //  }
00957 
00958   if (assoc_inner !=  assoc_outer) {
00959     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subsets must have same assoc ");
00960     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00961   }
00962 
00963   tempname = varname ? varname : "temp_subset";
00964 
00965 
00966   rc1 = fc_copySubset(subset_outer,mesh_outer,tempname, &tempSubset);
00967   if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS)
00968     return rc1;
00969   if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(subset_inner,FC_NULL_SUBSET) && !numMember_inner == 0){
00970     int* array;
00971 
00972     rc1 = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset_inner, &numMember_inner, &array);
00973     if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS)
00974       return rc1;
00975     rc1 = fc_deleteArrayMembersFromSubset(tempSubset, numMember_inner, array);
00976     if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS)
00977       return rc1;
00978     free(array);
00979   }
00980 
00981   if (newSubsets){ //even though this is more code, onyl 1 if check 
00982     //to determine the arg and do the delete, vs doing a temp
00983     //pts variable like i did for the name above and then
00984     //having to check again for the delete
00985     rc1 = fc_segment(tempSubset,shared_segdim, numSubset,newSubsets);
00986     if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS){
00987       fc_deleteSubset(tempSubset);
00988       return rc1;
00989     }
00990   } else {
00991     rc1 = fc_segment(tempSubset,shared_segdim, numSubset,&tempsubarray);
00992     if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS){
00993       fc_deleteSubset(tempSubset);
00994       return rc1;
00995     }
00996     for (i = 0; i < *numSubset; i++){
00997       fc_deleteSubset(tempsubarray[i]);
00998     }
00999     free(tempsubarray);
01000   }
01001 
01002   //clean up
01003   fc_deleteSubset(tempSubset);
01004 
01005   return FC_SUCCESS;
01006 }
01007 
01008 /**
01009  * \ingroup ElemDeath
01010  * \brief given an input subset and parameters for
01011  *  specifying neghbors, returns IDs of neighbors
01012  *  for which adding any single one individually to the subset will result in
01013  *  a greater segmentation of the mesh than results from
01014  *  segmenting based on the orginal subset
01015  *
01016  * \description
01017  *
01018  *  given an input subset and parameters for
01019  *  specifying neghbors, returns IDs of neighbors
01020  *  for which adding any single one individually to the subset will result in
01021  *  a greater segmentation of the mesh than results from
01022  *  segmenting based on the orginal subset.
01023  *
01024  *  Returns -1 in case of error. Passing in an empty subset returns
01025  *  -1.
01026  *
01027  *  Notes: 
01028  *   - No sense passing in anything more than level 1 since
01029  *     we are considering no element combos at this point.
01030  *   - This uses recursive innards that test on big sets of elem
01031  *     first and only narrow it down to smaller set if the big
01032  *     sets segment first. i.e., It is assumed that if a whole
01033  *     group doesnt result in any different segmenting, that the
01034  *     items of the group taken individually wont rest in different
01035  *     segmenting. There is the possibility that there could be
01036  *     offsetting effects that occur within the bigger set that
01037  *     will cuase this to be a faulty assumption, particularly
01038  *     when the dead region is near the boundary of the
01039  *     mesh. However, if this
01040  *     is used primarily for cases where we are looking for the
01041  *     mesh to be just about to break, then we expect that the
01042  *     num of elements that will satisfy the condition is small
01043  *     and so this should be ok. 
01044  *     
01045  *
01046  * \todo
01047  *
01048  *  - prob need a version that doesnt make the assumption that
01049  *    the recusion implies - esp for dead regions near
01050  *    boundary of mesh.
01051  *  - should this return IDS if it segments into fewer (ie
01052  *    subsumes the mesh, or causes to segments to combine ?). Note
01053  *    may cause problems with considering things as groups as effects
01054  *    might counter each other. 
01055  *  - may want a version that does combos of elem. the recursive
01056  *    innards, would not support that.
01057  *  - should we return num of resulting segments ?
01058  *  - should we make a time version or no ?
01059  *  - note: will need to upate if change return vals of recurive innard
01060  *  - do we want to explicity test the shareddim earlier in the call, and
01061  *    the unittest ratehr than them just being caught in the innards ?
01062  *
01063  * \modifications
01064  *   - 8/24/2005 ACG. Created.
01065  *   - 8/31/2005 ACG recusive version
01066  *   - 9/20/2005 ACG changed so uses new recursive innards taht retrun segmenting nodes
01067  *     instead of non-segmenting nodes so dont have to invert the list at the end.
01068  *   - 9/20/2005 ACG name change to reflect that will only be dealing with greater segmentation
01069  *   - 9/22/2005 ACG added segmentation dim
01070  *   - 10/9/05  ACG limited it to neighbor depth level 1
01071  */
01072 FC_ReturnCode fc_subsetPlusNeighborGreaterSegmentationMesh(
01073   FC_Subset subset, /**< input - subset testing on */
01074   int shared_neighbordim, /**< input - minimum dimensionality of shared part of neighbors */
01075   int shared_segdim, /**< input - shared dim for segmentation */
01076   int *numNbr, /**< output - number of neigbors that will individually cause greater segmentation */
01077   int **nbrIDs /**< output - IDS of neighbors that will individually cause greater segmentation */
01078   ){
01079   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01080   FC_AssociationType in_assoc;
01081   int numMember, maxNumMember;
01082   int numSubset, natNbr, *natNbrIDs, nmaxnsegids, *maxnsegids;
01083   int i;
01084   int level = 1;
01085 
01086   // default returns
01087   if (numNbr)
01088     *numNbr = -1;
01089   if (nbrIDs)
01090     *nbrIDs = NULL;
01091 
01092 
01093   // Test input (segment will check shared_segdim)
01094   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) ||  level < 1 || shared_neighbordim < 0 || 
01095       shared_neighbordim > 2 || !numNbr || !nbrIDs) {
01096     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01097     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01098   }
01099 
01100   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, &maxNumMember, &in_assoc);
01101   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01102     return rc;
01103 
01104   if (in_assoc != FC_AT_ELEMENT && in_assoc != FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) {
01105     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset must have element or whole association");
01106     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01107   }
01108 
01109 
01110   if (numMember == 0) {
01111     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot handle empty subset");
01112     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01113   }
01114 
01115 
01116   fc_printfLogMessage("subsetPlusNeighborsSegmentsMesh");
01117 
01118   //first determine the orignal segmentation
01119   rc = fc_subsetSegmentsMesh(subset,shared_segdim,NULL,&numSubset,NULL);
01120   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01121     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get original segmentation");
01122     return rc;
01123   }
01124 
01125   //now get the neighbors 
01126   rc = fc_getSubsetNeighbors(subset,level,shared_neighbordim,
01127                      &in_assoc,
01128                      &natNbr,&natNbrIDs);
01129   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01130     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get neighbors");
01131     return rc;
01132   }
01133   
01134   if (natNbr == 0){ //no neighbors - treat this as valid
01135     *numNbr = 0;
01136     return FC_SUCCESS;
01137   }
01138 
01139   rc = _fc_recursive_IndividuallySegmentingNodes(subset,numSubset,shared_segdim,
01140                         natNbr,natNbrIDs,
01141                         &nmaxnsegids, &maxnsegids);
01142   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01143     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get recursive segmenting nodes");
01144     if (natNbrIDs) free(natNbrIDs);
01145     return rc;
01146   }
01147 
01148   //clean up neighbor arrays
01149   if (natNbrIDs) free(natNbrIDs);
01150 
01151   //return vals from recursive call are all the vals we want to return
01152   //dont have to check them anymore
01153 
01154   //now set real return values
01155   *numNbr = nmaxnsegids;
01156   if (nmaxnsegids > 0){
01157     *nbrIDs = (int*)malloc(nmaxnsegids*sizeof(int));
01158     if (*nbrIDs == NULL){ //no lcean up in case of memory error
01159       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01160       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01161     }
01162 
01163     for (i = 0; i < nmaxnsegids;i++){
01164       (*nbrIDs)[i] = maxnsegids[i];
01165     }
01166   }
01167   if (maxnsegids) free(maxnsegids);
01168 
01169   return FC_SUCCESS;
01170 }
01171 
01172 
01173 //@}
01174 
01175 
01176 /** \name Characterizations of Dead Element Regions */
01177 //-------------------------------
01178 //@{
01179 
01180 
01181 /**
01182  * \ingroup ElemDeath
01183  * \brief Get tear length.
01184  *
01185  * \description 
01186  *
01187  *   This function is just for convenience - it calls fc_getExposedSkin()
01188  *   and then fc_getSubsetDiameter() (or fc_getDisplacedSubsetDiameter() if
01189  *   the displacement variable is provided).
01190  *
01191  * \todo Unit test this.
01192  *
01193  * \modifications
01194  *   - 7/6/2005 WSD. Created.
01195  */
01196 FC_ReturnCode fc_calcTearLength(
01197   FC_Subset subset, /**< input - A subset of "dead" elements */
01198   FC_Subset* opt_meshSkin,   /**< input - (optional) pointer to mesh skin 
01199                      (or NULL) */
01200   FC_Variable* displ_coords, /**< input - (optional) pointer to the owning
01201                     mesh's coordinate displacements (or NULL) */
01202   double* length    /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
01203 ) {
01204   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01205   FC_Subset exposed;
01206   rc = fc_getExposedSkin(subset, opt_meshSkin, &exposed);
01207   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01208     *length = -1;
01209     return rc;
01210   }
01211   if (displ_coords)
01212     rc = fc_getDisplacedSubsetDiameter(exposed, *displ_coords, length, NULL,
01213                            NULL);
01214   else
01215     rc = fc_getSubsetDiameter(exposed, length, NULL, NULL);
01216   fc_deleteSubset(exposed);
01217   return rc;
01218 }
01219 
01220 
01221 //@}
01222 
01223 
01224 /**
01225  * \ingroup PrivateElemDeath
01226  * \brief helper function that recursively determines 
01227  *  node ids that individually will result in greater segmentation than 
01228  *  some comparison value
01229  *  
01230  *
01231  * \description
01232  * 
01233  *  helper function that recursively determines 
01234  *  node ids that will individually result in greater segmentation than 
01235  *  some comparison value
01236  * 
01237  * Note:
01238  *   - This uses recursion to test on big sets of elem
01239  *     first and only narrow it down to smaller set if the big
01240  *     sets segment first. i.e., It is assumed that if a whole
01241  *     group doesnt result in a greater segmenting, that the
01242  *     items of the group taken individually wont result in a greater
01243  *     segmenting. There is the possibility that there could be
01244  *     offsetting effects that occur within the bigger set that
01245  *     will cuase this to be a faulty assumption, particularly
01246  *     when the dead region is close to the boundary of the
01247  *     mesh. However, if this
01248  *     is used primarily for cases where we are looking for the
01249  *     mesh to be just about to break, then we expect that the
01250  *     num of elements that will satisfy the condition is small
01251  *     and so this should be ok. 
01252  *
01253  * \todo
01254  * - will we want less segmentation too.
01255  *
01256  * \modifications
01257  *  - 9/20/05 ACG created in response to thinking that its better to
01258  *    return the segmenting rather than the nonsegmenting nodeset so
01259  *    dont have to do inversion of the set later. replaces 
01260  *    _fc_maximalNonSegmentingNodeset
01261  *  - 9/22/05 ACG added shared segdim
01262  *  - 10/09/05 ACG explicitly check that 1 element set doesnt result in 
01263  *    less segmentation (rather than just equal). will continue to
01264  *    loop for larger sets resulting in less segmentation (for instance
01265  *    if whole set of neighbors subsumes the live regions, still
01266  *    want to delve down into individual bits)
01267  */
01268 FC_ReturnCode _fc_recursive_IndividuallySegmentingNodes(
01269   FC_Subset subset,
01270   int compare,
01271   int shared_segdim,
01272   int numin,
01273   int* inset,
01274   int *numout,
01275   int** outset
01276 ){
01277   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01278   FC_Mesh mesh;
01279   FC_Subset testSubset;
01280   int numSegment;
01281   int i;
01282 
01283   //defaults
01284   *numout = 0;
01285   if (outset)
01286     *outset = NULL;
01287 
01288   // Test input (shared_segdim checked in fc_segment)
01289   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !numout || !outset ||
01290       numin < 0 || (!inset  && numin != 0)){
01291     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01292     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01293   }
01294 
01295 
01296   fc_printfLogMessage("recursive segmenting nodes");
01297   
01298   //  printf("\tChecking set (%d) ",numin);
01299   //  for (i = 0; i < numin; i++){
01300   //    printf("%d ", inset[i]);
01301   //  }
01302   //  printf("\n");
01303   
01304   if (numin == 0){
01305     return FC_SUCCESS;
01306   }
01307 
01308   //now lets get a copy of the subset to play with
01309   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset,&mesh);
01310   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01311     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh");
01312     return rc;
01313   }
01314 
01315   rc = fc_copySubset(subset,mesh,"test_subset",&testSubset);
01316   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01317     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant copy subset");
01318     return rc;
01319   }
01320   
01321   //now see if adding if the whole set does anything
01322   rc = fc_addArrayMembersToSubset(testSubset,numin,inset);
01323   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01324     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant add ids to subset");
01325     return rc;
01326   }
01327 
01328 
01329   rc =  fc_subsetSegmentsMesh(testSubset,shared_segdim,NULL,
01330                      &numSegment,NULL);
01331   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01332     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to segment");
01333     return rc;
01334   }
01335 
01336   rc = fc_deleteSubset(testSubset);
01337 
01338   //compare is passed in so we dont have to recalc it each time, but it better
01339   //be correct
01340   if (numSegment == compare){ 
01341     //    printf("elements as a group do not divide any more (or less) (%d). maximal recursion - returning 0 elem\n",numSegment);
01342     //then adding the vals doesnt cause any greater segmentation
01343     *numout = 0;
01344   } else {
01345     if (numin == 1){
01346       if (numSegment <= compare){
01347      //     printf("single element %d doesnt divide more. maximal recursion - returning 1 elem\n",inset[0]);
01348      *numout = 0;
01349       }else {
01350      //     printf("single element %d divides. maximal recursion - returning 1 elem\n",inset[0]);
01351      *numout = 1;
01352      *outset = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int));
01353      if (*outset == NULL){
01354        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01355        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01356      }
01357      (*outset)[0] = inset[0];
01358       }
01359     }else{
01360       int idiv = numin/2;
01361       int *seta, *setb;
01362       int *reta, *retb, nreta, nretb;
01363 
01364       //      printf("this does divide - recursing\n");
01365 
01366       seta = malloc(idiv*sizeof(int));
01367       setb = malloc((numin-idiv)*sizeof(int));
01368       if ((seta == NULL && idiv > 0) || (setb == NULL && numin-idiv > 0)){
01369      fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01370      return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01371       }
01372       for (i = 0; i < idiv; i++){
01373      seta[i] = inset[i];
01374       }
01375       for (i = 0; i < numin-idiv; i++){
01376      setb[i] = inset[i+idiv];
01377       }
01378 
01379       //      printf("\tcalling set A\n");
01380       rc = _fc_recursive_IndividuallySegmentingNodes(subset,compare,shared_segdim,
01381                            idiv,seta,&nreta,&reta);
01382       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01383      fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get recursive segmenting nodes");
01384      free(seta);
01385      free(setb);
01386      return rc;
01387       }
01388 
01389       //      printf("\tcalling set B\n");
01390       rc = _fc_recursive_IndividuallySegmentingNodes(subset,compare,shared_segdim,
01391                            numin-idiv,setb,&nretb,&retb);
01392       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01393      fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get recursive segmenting nodes");
01394      free(seta);
01395      free(setb);
01396      return rc;
01397       }
01398 
01399       free(seta);
01400       free(setb);
01401       
01402       *numout = nreta + nretb;
01403       if (*numout > 0){
01404      *outset = (int*)malloc(*numout*sizeof(int));
01405      if (*outset == NULL){
01406        //no cleanup in case of memory error
01407        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01408        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01409      }
01410      for (i = 0; i < nreta; i++){
01411        (*outset)[i] = reta[i];
01412      }
01413      for (i = 0; i < nretb; i++){
01414        (*outset)[i+nreta] = retb[i];
01415      }
01416      //      if (*numout != 0) printf("\trecur: %d in %d out\n",numin,*numout);
01417      if (reta) free(reta); //they will be NULL otherwise
01418      if (retb) free(retb);
01419       }
01420     }
01421   }
01422 
01423   return FC_SUCCESS;
01424 }
